utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: To be, or not to be, that is the question. Whether it is nobler - Whether it - Whether it’s - What? Whether ’tis - Whether ’tis - ’tis - ’tis.

utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: Connect to the words. Connect to me. Connect the words to me.

utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: To be, or not to be, that is the question. Whether ’tis nobler in the mind to suffer -

utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: Hello? Who’s there?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, I haven’t seen you this excited since - uh, well, earlier this morning, so…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what this is, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but I know that a very secure messenger just brought it in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, my. It’s absolutely beautiful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The YOLO card.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like, “Dude, I just drove my mom’s car into the river, hashtag YOLO”?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, this - work of art will forever release YOLO from internet jail. You see, each card was painstakingly handcrafted by an international team of artisans. Note the flecks of actual black diamond embedded in the card. The state-of-the-art radio frequency I.D. chip. The - the best part - Only 10,000 people in the world were chosen to have a YOLO card, and I’m one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s just a credit card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: *Just* a credit card? I think not, my good woman. This is a YOLO, as in, “You only live once.” It is a way of life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s a way to be obnoxious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, is it? You see, for every dollar I spend seizing my own day, YOLO matches it to help someone less fortunate seize their dreams.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Well, that’s a little less obnoxious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what I thought. So, you want to try it out, take it for a spin? Might help you with tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm? What’s tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, don’t tell me you forgot. Our weekly date night. It’s new. It’s our thing. It’s - it’s your turn to arrange it, remember?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Of cour - Of course I remember. I don’t need a YOLO card to help me out with that. I’ve already got it planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, do you? So tell me, how are you going to top my American Revolution evening I arranged with the carriage ride to see Hamilton on Broadway, the dinner served by waiters dressed as Founding Fathers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, that was fun. Except when Ben Franklin started hitting on me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s nothing. George Washington slipped me his digits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what are we doing tonight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, well, it’s a surprise, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I love surprises. At least tell me what to wear. On a wardrobe scale of 1 to 10 - 10 being James Bond, 1 being “Big Lebowski” - give me a number.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For now, 5 — crime-scene casual. Hey. Beckett. Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s great. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that Zane Cannon?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep, star of the Apocalypse Runner movie franchise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love those movies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, me too, even though - no disrespect to the dead - this guy couldn’t act to save his life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Quite literally, by the looks of things.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was Zane rehearsing Hamlet alone this morning?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, it was last night. The M.E. places time of death between 8:00 and 11:00 p.m.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A quill pen. Odd choice for a murder weapon, unless, of course, the murderer was the ghost of William Shakespeare killing Zane for butchering his words. It’s all the talk on Broadway that Zane had no business performing the Bard’s most famous role.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why cast him, then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because movie stars sell tickets. Just ask my mother. She can’t stop talking about the Hollywood-ization of Broadway.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold on. Hey, what are you doing? Give me that.

utterance.speaker: JAKE
utterance.content: I was just - Nice try. I already uploaded it to the cloud.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Officer, escort this dirtbag out of here and confiscate that jacket.

utterance.speaker: JAKE
utterance.content: That - That - That’s my phone. You - you legally can’t have that phone. Hey, gimme my phone!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See that? Our victim’s fame is already turning this into a media circus.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, fellas, may I introduce to you Erin Cherloff? She is the play’s director and a true artist. Your production of Antigone was a revelation.

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Oh, well, thank you. I can’t believe this is happening. Zane and I finally get a chance to work together after all these years, and this happens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The two of you were friends?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Yeah, since theater school. Zane dropped out to go to Hollywood, but we stayed close.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know what he was doing here in the theater by himself last night?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: He was terrified…of Hamlet. He really wanted to show his acting chops in this role. Sometimes he would come here after hours to work more.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was Zane having problems with anyone you know of?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: It’s no secret he had a reputation for sleeping with his leading ladies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying Zane was sleeping with the actress playing Ophelia?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Naomi Fox. Mm-hmm. They had a messy breakup recently. She sort of went all Fatal Attraction. So she took a baseball bat to his DB9. He had me take photos for his insurance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Did he report that to the police?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: No. Look, I’ve worked with Naomi before, and she’s crazy, but actor crazy, not murderer crazy. However , there is one teeny, tiny little thing you should know about. Naomi’s a method actor, meaning she doesn’t play the characters - she becomes them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know where we can find her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just hope I wasn’t too obvious back there. I’m just such a big fan of Erin Cherloff.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who, the director?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s amazing. I’m - Just speaking with her, I got this great idea for the play at Sarah Grace’s preschool where I’m a volunteer at.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, preschools have plays now? My preschool was going to work with my mom every day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, same here. I grew up in hallways just like this. Spending time in my mother’s dressing room, experimenting with her costumes, her makeup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, get over it. Anyway, maybe our method actress has gone a little too method. In the play, Hamlet drives Ophelia mad. If this is life imitating art and she’s gone full Ophelia, we should be ready for anything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ms. Fox?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Fox? NYPD. We need to ask you a few questions. Ms. Fox.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, may I? Ophelia?

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Aye, my lord?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These fair gentlemen are constables and wish to speak with you in matters regarding the murder most foul and unnatural of Zane Cannon.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: ’Tis too much to bear to think on it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How now, fair Ophelia. We have queries and thou shall answer, or we shall force perforce be moved to make a star chamber -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop. We are SO not doing this. Look, Naomi, we know that you were having a show-mance with Zane. He dumped you, and then you busted up his car.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: My lord, he speaks with a curious tongue. Car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s what he’s gonna put you in the back of when he arrests you for murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So stop the Daniel Day-Lewis routine and start talking, or…

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Okay, look, I wasn’t in my right mind when I smashed up Zane’s car, but I didn’t kill him. You have to believe me. I was out late last night bar-hopping with some of the cast. You can check it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bar-hopping? So you’re not full Method.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless she was drinking mead and eating with her fingers.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Look, I really cared for Zane, but he was acting like he was cheating on me, showing up at my place at all hours of the night, lame excuses. So I confronted him, and he blew up, told me never to ask where he goes again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any idea who this other woman might be?

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: No. But whoever she was, she brought out his dark side.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: We have breaking news on the shocking death of Hollywood megastar Zane Cannon, whose body was found this morning onstage at the off-Broadway Citizens Theater.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, why is there a video of Zane’s body on the news?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A stalker-azzi snuck onto the crime scene wearing an NYPD windbreaker.

utterance.speaker: NEWS PRESENTER
utterance.content: A source at the scene reveals that leading the investigation into the star’s murder is none other than acclaimed mystery writer Richard Castle with an assist from the NYPD’s 12th Precinct…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 1PP has been on my ass about keeping media under control, and now my husband is the face of the investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not all bad news, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a great photo of me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we have a suspect?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet. Naomi’s alibi checked out. But we do have a lead on this mystery woman that Zane was seeing. His financials came in. They say that he rented a limo yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which makes sense, since Naomi trashed his DB9.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where was this limo going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know yet. I’m still waiting for the driver to call me back, but hopefully he knows who this woman is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have already found her. It turns out that Zane was renting a suite at the Black Door Hotel under a fake name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, the Black Door. Yes, very fancy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Known for being discreet… …from what I’ve heard from other people who were once single and now married.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, they certainly seem to be living up to that reputation. Wouldn’t say a word until I accused them of obstruction. But Zane has had a suite there for the past two weeks, and he was with a woman there every night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, who is this woman?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No idea. She’s not a registered guest, but get this, not only did she arrive after our time-of-death window, she’s still there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Privacy light is on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She must still be here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD. Could you open it, please?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Psst. There’s a ginger in the bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother?!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Richard?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I, um, I got tired, waiting for Zane last night, so I just, uh, crawled into bed. Never could I imagine what happened to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, why are you - why - Why - Why were you in Zane’s bed?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Because he was late for our session.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of session?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that what they call it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s enough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, are you saying you were sleeping with Zane Cannon?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, drop the gavel, Richard! I was his acting coach, certainly not his mistress. The poor boy was out of his depth trying to play Hamlet, so he was referred to me. Zane needed me to be on call 24 hours a day, so he had this suite so that we could meet comfortably at any time. We turned this room into a temple to the Bard. It also became a temple to a new life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, new life?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, you know I’m a life coach. I helped Zane to just clear out the clutter of stardom so that he could focus on his craft.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did he ever mention having any enemies?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, but he did have some demons, though. There was something in his past that was a real block for him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Certainly he told you what the block was.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, he was very secretive about it, frightened, even. Oh, of course, I encouraged him to engage with those demons, and… Wait a minute, the last time we spoke, he said that he had made arrangements to do just that. Oh, dear God. Don’t tell me that I might have pushed him into something that got him killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No. Nothing like that. No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Come on. Let’s get you home. Come on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, wait. Hey, listen. It’s my turn to plan date night, but I forgot, and Castle’s gonna lord it over me if I don’t outdo what he did last week. So I need a few ideas.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait - for Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait. The, uh - the guy who, uh, took you on an urban spelunking adventure through the city subway tunnels last Halloween, and then he hired actors to re-enact scenes from the movie C.H.U.D. Yeah, I can’t - I can’t come up with stuff like that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just heard back from that limo driver that Zane hired the morning of his murder. You’ll never believe where he went — Sing Sing Penitentiary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did he go there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To pick up a newly released inmate — Johnny Toro, who also happens to be his estranged older stepbrother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did we not know that Zane had a stepbrother?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Different dads, different names, and according to Zane’s publicist, he kept it quiet. He didn’t want to be associated with this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then why’d he show up at the prison?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. According to the limo driver, though, it was far from a happy family reunion. The privacy screen was up, but he could tell that Toro was yelling at Zane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He served 12 years for a B_E.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where he stewed on how much he hated Zane. Check out the prison psychologist’s notes. Apparently there was a lot of built-up rage against Zane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, evidence suggests that this break-in was a two-man job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Cops suspected Zane but only had evidence against Toro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then Toro took the fall.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Zane moves to Hollywood and becomes a movie star.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, get him in here.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: This what it’s gonna be like now I’m on parole? Just can’t go a day without being harassed by the cops?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not when you set a record for fastest recidivism.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were out all of 10 hours before you murdered Zane.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: See? Soon as I saw the news, I knew y’all were gonna hang that on me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? That’s your response? Not, “Boo-hoo, my stepbrother’s dead.”

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: Screw you. I’m busted up over what happened to Z.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, you’re pissed that he let you take the rap all those years ago.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: I don’t know what the hell you’re talking about, man. I was the big brother. I made Z keep his mouth shut on that B_E we pulled, man. Told him to make something of himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, bro. Your prison shrink noted that you had a giant hate-on for Zane.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: He abandoned me. And not one visit. No calls. Didn’t put any money on my books. Nothing. Just went off to become a star, and he left me to rot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Limo driver said things got pretty heated when he picked you up.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: Yeah, but what the limo driver didn’t hear was us squashing our beef, ‘cause he apologized, said he would set me up for the rest of my life. Just had to get his financial problems figured out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What financial problems? Zane had $10 million in the bank.

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: He owed the IRS 15 mil in back taxes. He was gonna be broke in like two months.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then why’d he walk away from an $8 million payday in that Safe Word movie to go do Shakespeare?

utterance.speaker: TORO
utterance.content: He said he had a plan to get paid. Something big, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like whatever money-making scheme Zane was involved in is probably what got him killed. Only question is -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - what the hell are you doing, Kevin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, figured it out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What he was involved in?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. The new choreography for Sarah Grace’s preschool play.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, good. Why don’t you keep working on that while I solve our homicide? Let me get a plain hot dog.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We are being filmed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s that stalker-azzi I chased off the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, buddy, what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: This is a public street. I have a right to film here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, cool, cool, cool. We just want to know why you’re filming us.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Well, I want the same thing you guys do — an ending to Zane Cannon’s story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You’ve been tracking our investigation by tracking us?

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: I’ve been working on an expose on Zane ever since he dropped out of the movie Safe Word to play Hamlet. I knew that pretty boy was a train wreck waiting to happen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’ve been following Zane?

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: On and off, ever since he got to New York a month ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So did you see him on the night of his murder?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look, come on, you want an ending to your story? Why don’t you show us what you got?

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t work for favors. I want an interview with the killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, and I want a baby unicorn with a rainbow tail — for my daughter. We’re both gonna be disappointed, pal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, man, show us what you got. If it’s any good, when we make an arrest, we’ll let you film the perp walk. Deal?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s go for a walk.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: I filmed this yesterday at the theater around 4:00.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s about six hours before Zane was killed.

utterance.speaker: MAN ON SCREEN
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, it’s right here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s the guy with the tats?

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: No idea.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Who’s that, Zane?

utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: Yo!

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Why’d you pay him all that cash for the phone?

utterance.speaker: ZANE
utterance.content: Come on, come on! Give me that camera. You’re gonna get me killed.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Hell, I thought Zane was just being dramatic. I guess I was dead wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re gonna need you to leave the room, Jake.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Heck, maybe get that facial recognition - we’ll print out something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah - no, no, no. Leave the laptop.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: No way, lady. This is my property.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jake. Now.

utterance.speaker: STALKERAZZI
utterance.content: Geez.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell did Zane get himself mixed up with?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s only one way to know. We’ve got to find this mystery man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, L. T., you seen Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: elodie, thank you very much for taking time to Skype with me. I just - I wanted to share with you my vision of the play.

utterance.speaker: ELODIE
utterance.content: Your vision?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I see the kids as embodying the circle of life.

utterance.speaker: ELODIE
utterance.content: It’s just a flower dance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me just show you what I mean. Okay, so, the kids — They’re stacked up, and then — flower, flower - They’re exploding, fanning out. Flower, flower, flower!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fun! Flower growing in the sun — And then, then they circle back. Kind of a, you know, Busby Berkeley thing.

utterance.speaker: ELODIE
utterance.content: Kevin. Kevin. The oldest kids are five. We’ll be lucky if they can just sing the song.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we need to think outside the box here.

utterance.speaker: ELODIE
utterance.content: Think outside of the box next year, after my kid has graduated.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, well, hey, elodie, if you’re gonna be like that, maybe we need to look into your unpaid parking tickets, run them through the system…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kevin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: …see if there’s any lien…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve got that, uh, case that we’re working.

utterance.speaker: ELODIE
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop. Step away from the laptop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the same guy that Zane bought the burner phone off of.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This footage is dated four weeks ago, so obviously he and Zane had an ongoing arrangement.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold up. I recognize this guy. Yeah, that’s Alejandro Guzman. He’s a big shot-caller for a gang called Los Maldives - The Damned. They operate out of Spanish Harlem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same neighborhood that Zane grew up in. Maybe the two of them knew each other back in the day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Before Zane got famous doing all those Apocalypse Runner movies. We’ll go up to Spanish Harlem and see if we can track down this guy.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: I know nothing about nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, got video of you meeting with Zane on the day he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: You got me on video killing him? Yeah, that’s what I thought. May I go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See, we did our homework.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we know that your little brother Antonio is doing a little stretch update at Fishkill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a long way for your mother to travel on visiting day. Especially with her bad knees.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: How you know about my mama?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I got an old Army buddy who works for the Federal Bureau of Prisons. He slipped me your file.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi, I bet your old Army buddy could get his brother transferred closer to the city, make those visits a little easier on mama.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but he’d have to be willing to talk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: I don’t make deals with police.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, that’s fine. My buddy also tells me that there’s a bunch of openings at a federal penitentiary in Georgia.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It would be, like, what, a 13-, 14-hour bus ride?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At least.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kind of rough on mama.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: All right. I’ll talk about Zane, but I’m not giving you names. I’m not ratting anyone out in my crew. I knew Zane back in the day. Just a neighborhood punk. A month ago, he shows up out of the blue asking to get in touch with my boss.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’s your boss?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold up, are you talking about… the *boss* boss? El Oso?

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: I said no names.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, El Oso? Head of the cartel? The Mexican government, the DEA, the FBI — They’re all looking for this guy. He escaped from prison in Mexico three months ago. Are you saying that you know where El Oso is hiding?

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then why would Zane come to see you?

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: Because I got a little bird, and I put out my little bird to the right people until the message gets to you know who.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clearly, you charge for this little-bird service.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: Ten grand gets you a burner. If the boss wants to talk, you get a phone call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And a month ago, Zane wanted to talk to your boss.

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: Some kind of business proposition. Zane even got himself a face-to-face with the boss ‘cause he’s a movie star and all. Only, from what I hear, it didn’t go so good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why did Zane buy another burner from you on the day he was killed?

utterance.speaker: GUZMAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But if he pissed off the boss a second time, it’s not on me he ended up dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jorge “El Oso” Zamacona. He’s part folk hero, part demon, the rest pure monster.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The man kills anyone who crosses him — cops, journalists, politicians.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zane must have been real desperate for money to want to do business with this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he wanted to be El Oso’s new drug pipeline to Hollywood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, chances are we’ll never find out. I mean, if the DEA, FBI, and the Mexican government can’t find him, then what chances do we have?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll reach out to my Fed contacts.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we’ll drill down all of El Oso’s stateside connections.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I suppose that puts the brakes on our date night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Sorry, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no, I’m sorry for you. You’re the one who put all the planning into our special evening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I - I did. I - Yeah, I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? I think I’ll take my mother out to dinner, maybe cheer her up after all this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re such a good son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you’re such a good everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh… Hey buddy. Parked a little close. Hey. You look… Okay, don’t mind me. I’m just gonna go out the passenger side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Catch a — Oh. Didn’t mean to — Meant to do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, now you move? Thanks, you idiot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you guys? What do you want? Where am I?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Buenas noches.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Do you know who I am?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: El Oso.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, you get me a lead on Zamacona, and we will run it. Yeah. Okay, I got to go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hi, darling, I know you’re busy, but is Richard here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I thought he was at dinner with you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, well, he didn’t show up, and his cell went right to voicemail, so I figured he must be here immersed in the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he’s probably out playing with his fancy new credit card, but let me check in on him. Alexis put new tracking software on my laptop. I’ll just ping his cell. There we go. 7th and 53rd.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That’s the parking garage across from the restaurant where we were supposed to meet an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know what? Just give me a second. Hi, uh, this is Captain Beckett. I need a unit at 53rd and 7th.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I saw you on the news. You’re working with the Federales to investigate Zane Cannon’s death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean his murder. Well, uh, I mean that we knew Zane was in contact with you about a business proposition and that you were in contact with him just hours before his - untimely demise.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: You think I killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have been associated with a fair amount of violence in your past.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I believe the adjective you’re looking for is, uh, “epic”. An epic amount of violence. Some might even say biblical.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you can see why your involvement with Zane would have the police curious.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: If I wanted him dead, I would have cut him open when he was standing where you are now. I wouldn’t kill him with a pen. That’s cute. Do I look like a man who kills cute?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, certainly not. You also don’t look like the sort of man who needs to resort to cheap scare tactics. I mean, why don’t you just untie me? We’ll sit down, and you tell me why you brought me here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: You think Zane contacted me about drugs, no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What else is there?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Yo. Yo miso. El Oso. The most infamous cartel boss in history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Zane wanted the rights to your life story — the El Oso biopic.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: He thought portraying me would win him an Oscar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I said no. He may be big box office, but the man cannot act. He got upstaged by a CGI aardvark in that pelicula de fantasia. So I made him an ultimatum.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re the one who made him drop Safe Word and do Hamlet.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I needed to see that he was serious. That he really could act. So I told him if he got a good review in the Times, my life rights were his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he had contact with you before the show premiered.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: He wanted to meet with me again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I don’t know. He said it had to do with the movie, but I could smell his desperation through the phone, especially when I said no. And later that night he was dead. Pero mira. I didn’t bring you all the way out here to talk about los muertos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: When I saw you on television, I knew fate had put you in my path, Richard Castle. I’m a man of the people. You are a popular writer. You write for the people. That’s why you must tell my story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want me to write the script for your movie?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Si! Si! It will be fun! I will tell you all about myself. And then you will just typey, typey, typey. It should only take six months, maybe a year. And you will stay here with me!

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Or I will mail your body home… piece by piece.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got security footage from the garage, and it’s not good.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my — oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Escalade is registered to a shell corp that’s a known front for El Oso.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You can track the SUV, can’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can, but they probably swapped cars at least once by now, and with a two-hour head start, we’re looking at a 100-mile search radius, and we still have no idea what we’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There must be something that you can do. This is Richard’s life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: YOLO.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s cold, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No - Castle’s new credit card. The kidnappers left his cell phone by the car, but he might still have his wallet with him. And the new YOLO card has an upgraded RFID chip in it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if they passed within range of a tollbooth or a gas station…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then it’ll pick up the chip, and we’ll be able to track his movement.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’ll call the credit card company, see if that card has pinged anywhere.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, poor Richard. I can’t even imagine how he must be suffering.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your life is, without a doubt, a Shakespearean drama.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: I’ve always felt a strong connection to Macbeth. Ambitious, but tortured by his conscience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With your relationship to torture, I think you’re a little more Richard III, am I right?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: The hunchback?!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was thinking, uh, more along the lines of Sir Laurence Olivier.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: A man does not achieve what I have without great personal cost!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jorge, I only meant you —

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Do you think I cannot see that the stains on my soul appear upon my sleeve, as well? Are you the royal fool who dares believe he can mock the king he serves?!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No — I’m just the funny kind of court jester.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Then give me proof of your humility by giving me your life!

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Ah, Ricardo, I wish you could see your face! It’s priceless!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, good one.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Richard III had no sense of humor, but I do. These are the facets of my character that you must capture.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you should really play yourself in this movie.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Ah, if only. But sadly, I’m a fugitive, persecuted and misunderstood. Until you tell my story, that is. Now, let’s talk money, huh?

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Will 5 million be enough?

utterance.speaker: AGENT RICHMOND
utterance.content: Jorge Zamacona, this is the DEA. We have you surrounded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no — Jorge, wait, wait, wait! You remember how Richard III ended. You could write your own ending here.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: An artist must be true to the material and himself.

utterance.speaker: ZAMACONA
utterance.content: Open the hatch!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Hey, over there!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: He’s down, he’s down!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Three down. Castle’s here.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Are you hurt, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m fine. I’m fine. I —

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But I may not be for long.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was just instinct. He was running by and I tripped him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You did good, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not good! Not good at all. I tripped a drug lord. It’s my fault he got caught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The DEA had the building surrounded. El Oso wasn’t getting away, even if you didn’t trip him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sadly, despite your abduction being a fantastic story, we’re still no closer to finding out who killed Zane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wouldn’t be so sure about that. The DEA confiscated a dozen burner phones from El Oso’s barn. One of those phones was the one he used to call Zane the day he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So they have Zane’s burner phone number, which means we can find out if he called anyone else.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can, and he did. An international line in Mexico, and you won’t believe who it belongs to — El Oso’s younger brother, Hector Zamacona, a legit businessman who publicly condemns El Oso every chance he gets.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If he’s in Mexico, how did Zane connect with him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Both ends of that call from Zane’s phone pinged off towers here in the city. Baby bro’s in town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know where he is now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hector Zamacona might have been the last person to speak to Zane, which means he may know something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, what’s your wife doing here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: elodie from the preschool called about the play. It seems some of the parents have some…concerns.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, yeah. Um, they’re, uh, struggling with my vision. I’ll call elodie in the morning. I’ll walk her through it.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Actually, they have decided to go a different direction.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, they’re firing me? The play’s tomorrow. It’s that elodie, isn’t it? PTA’s not enough for that mom-ster. She has to —

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Kevin, it’s all the parents.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Everybody loves your enthusiasm. It’s just — they’re preschoolers. They’re not Broadway stars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, no soft-shoe?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: No. No soft-shoe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Come here. It happens.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, other than pissing off a homicidal drug lord, how did you enjoy our surprise date night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying you planned my abduction by a fugitive cartel leader?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, complete with the daring rescue and everything. It was fun, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think date night counts when it’s a candlelit dinner with the butcher of Guadalajara.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’ll — I’ll plan something else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something else? You didn’t have a plan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you realize how pressure-filled this is, always trying to top each other?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s half the fun of it. Our rivalry is what fuels the passionate fire… Rivalry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rivalry. Between two brothers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? What rivalry?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The one between Jorge “El Oso” Zamacona and his brother, Hector.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A rivalry would explain why Zane was working with both brothers, but how do we prove it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just need to find one piece of evidence to see that I’m on the right track. And that could be it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, my Spanish is a little rusty, but my handy translator says…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hector Zamacona’s been sleeping with his brother’s wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They have been shacking up ever since El Oso went on the run.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Zane might have been caught in a rivalry between the brothers, and that’s what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hector wants more than just El Oso’s wife. According to the DEA, all of his, uh, “legitimate” businesses — they’re suspected fronts for money laundering.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So with big brother on the run, Hector can make a play to rule the family in his place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Hector can never truly own the throne until his brother is dead. A powerful family, a cartel for a kingdom, two brothers locked in a battle for control. Guys, this is just like the play. Hamlet’s father is killed by his brother, who then takes the throne and marries the dead brother’s wife. There’s a reason they say Shakespeare endures. This is a real-life Hamlet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, thematic similarities aside, why would Hector need Zane to take down El Oso?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Hector didn’t know where to find his brother.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And movie-star Zane had a face-to-face with El Oso.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Making Zane the perfect Trojan Horse to lead Hector to his brother.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would Zane agree to do that? He wanted to star in the El Oso movie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Money. Hector’s worth hundreds of millions. Zane needed the money now, not in three years, when the movie could get off the ground.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Hector offers to solve Zane’s money problems in exchange for Zane leading him to El Oso.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But El Oso refuses to meet with Zane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then, rather than wait to see if Zane’s Hamlet reviews are good enough to meet with El Oso, Hector decides to cut his losses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which, in this family, translates to murder.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: My brother’s bloody hand has brought shame on our family. We’re better off with him back in a cage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, yeah, I mean, you’re definitely better off. You didn’t even have to pay for Zane Cannon’s tax debts.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: Why would I pay a movie star’s taxes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To get him to lead you to your brother. That way you could kill El Oso and take over the family business, much in the same way you took over the family bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when Zane couldn’t get a second meeting with El Oso, he was a loose end, so you killed him.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: I did not kill Zane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that Zane called you from a burner phone hours before he was killed. We also know that you put $15 million into a holding account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The exact amount of his tax bill.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: Let’s say I did have a deal with him. Why would I kill him a week before Hamlet previews? According to you, good reviews would have gotten him another meeting with my brother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But that would have put Zane out in the cold for his Oscar-winning role. And even with a big payoff, it would have been tough to get him to walk away from that role.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless you promised him he could keep it anyway. With your brother dead, the life rights would revert to you.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: I could care less about the El Oso biopic. I told him he could direct it for all I cared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait — you told Zane he could star in and direct his dream project?

utterance.speaker: HECTOR
utterance.content: Only I guess Zane had already promised the job to someone else — someone who would not be happy to lose it.

utterance.speaker: OPHELIA
utterance.content: O, woe is me. T’have seen what I have seen —

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: No. You - You’ve got to feel it more. This isn’t just some guy who broke up with you on Snapchat. Hamlet betrayed you. He never loved you. “Get thee to a nunnery,” right? Hamlet took everything from you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s certainly a scene you can relate to, isn’t it, Ms. Cherloff?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Uh, this is a private rehearsal. We have a break in 20. Can you let us finish?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think maybe you are finished.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All respect to the Bard, we’re here with a tale of our own — one with betrayal and jealousy, though sadly classic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A truly gifted director watches as her former classmate’s star rises in Hollywood, while she fought like hell for every opportunity.

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: I love what I do. So what if Zane made millions because he chose the gym over acting school? I make art.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But when Zane asked you to cast him as Hamlet, you told him no, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Yes, until he convinced me he was right for the part.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: By offering you your big break directing the El Oso biopic?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it was a Hollywood promise. Not worth a damn. Tell me, did he confess to you that he would be directing the picture on his own, or did he just tell you you lost the job?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: Neither. Because it didn’t happen. I don’t know anything about an El Oso project.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then how do you explain the browser history on your laptop?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or the shoes in your closet with Zane’s blood on them?

utterance.speaker: ERIN
utterance.content: You have no idea what a risk it was putting Zane in this play. And the only thing that made it worthwhile was directing that movie. And then he tells me that he’s gonna do it — and I’m left with maybe the worst production of Hamlet in history. I mean, my career is as good as over. Do you have any idea how difficult it is as a woman to break into directing film? And he took away my shot like it was nothing. I heard him that night, torturing maybe the most beautiful words ever written for the stage, and I just snapped.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This way, Ms. Cherloff.

utterance.speaker: OPHELIA
utterance.content: Is that a wrap on rehearsal?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You still mad about being fired off Sarah Grace’s preschool play?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, only at myself. I swore I’d never be that dad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, the kind that makes an ass of himself by dancing around like a flower for his daughter?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, the kind — — the kind who gets caught up in what he wants, not what his kid does.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: SARAH GRACE
utterance.content: Daddy!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Look at my little sunflower!

utterance.speaker: SARAH GRACE
utterance.content: Uncle Javi!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey baby.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was just leaving. Aren’t you guys already supposed to be there?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Uh, she didn’t want to go. Wouldn’t say why. She just wants you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh…hey, sweetie. Look, you don’t have to sing if you don’t want to. That’s the law.

utterance.speaker: SARAH GRACE
utterance.content: But you’ll be sad if I don’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? No.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: I think it’s more she forgot the words.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, do — do you want me to help you remember the words? Okay, I’ll do it with you. Ready? Okay. Get your hands ready. Flower, flower, flower fun —

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Flower growing in the sun — Raindrops fall from clouds up high — We spin around!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yay! Nice!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think you’re ready, S.G. All right? So we’ll go to the play?

utterance.speaker: SARAH GRACE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s ready.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SARAH GRACE
utterance.content: This time I want to…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This date night is everything I dreamed it would be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aww. Well, given all the recent excitement, I thought that a quiet night in would be nice for a change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ohhh, you did plan something. What is it? Flash mob, treasure hunt, land shark?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, I swear. I don’t know who’s at the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. Castle, is that another credit card? Because I am YOLO’d out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a credit card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Script notes, biographical materials. It’s from El Oso. Beckett, you know what this means?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He still wants you to write his script.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he doesn’t want me dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Until he reads the first draft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s that. “These materials only cover the first two acts of our movie. The third act is yet to come, and it starts with a bang.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Espo. — Seriously? El Oso just escaped federal detention.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?! They should call this guy El Houdini.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, wait, hey, Castle, where are you going? Date night’s not over yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is for me. I gotta start writing this script. Typey, typey, typey!
